intro: Cryptocarya tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled cryptocarya, is a flowering plant species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocados. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, glossy leaves that are typically four-angled in cross-section. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, dark berries. Cryptocarya tetragona is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it contributes to the understory vegetation.
